responses: To start MATLAB, double-click the MATLAB shortcut icon on your Windows desktop. You will know MALTAB is running 		when you see the special prompt in the MATLAB Command Window.
To end your MATLAB session, select Exit MATLAB from the File menu in the desktop, or type quit (or exit) in the Command Window, or with easy way by click on close button in control box.

patterns: For what0 Command window is used?
responses: Command Window is used to enter variables and run functions and M-files.

patterns: For what purpose Command history is used?
responses: Statements you enter in the Command Window are logged in the Command History. In the Command History, you can view 	previously run statements, and copy and execute selected statements.
MATLAB file operations use the current directory reference point. Any file you want to run must be in the current directory or on the search path.
The MATLAB workspace consists of the set of variables (named arrays) built up during a MATLAB session and stored in memory.
Clears the Command window and homes the cursor.
help <Topic> displays help about that Topic if it exist.
